intro: Gomphrena pulchella f. pulchella, commonly known as the common gomphrena, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and vibrant, spiky inflorescences that range in color from red to pink and purple. The plant produces small, scale-like leaves and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its long-lasting blooms and drought tolerance. Gomphrena pulchella f. pulchella is a member of the Amaranthaceae family, which includes other ornamental and edible plants.
